Line 100: Line 100:  
A third group of psychological theories that have implications for the nature of ethics are based on [[evolutionary psychology]]. These theories are based on the assumption that the behavior that ethics prescribe can sometimes be seen as an evolutionary adaptation. For instance, altruism towards members of one's own family promotes one's [[inclusive fitness]].
 
A third group of psychological theories that have implications for the nature of ethics are based on [[evolutionary psychology]]. These theories are based on the assumption that the behavior that ethics prescribe can sometimes be seen as an evolutionary adaptation. For instance, altruism towards members of one's own family promotes one's [[inclusive fitness]].
    −
====Legal ethics====
+
== Ethics in the School ==
−
{{main|Legal ethics}}
  −
Ethics has been applied to [[criminology]] leading to the field of [[criminal justice]].
      −
+
Ethics can be used in school situations. They can be used in such schools as high school or college. Rules and cheating are a big part of ethics. Certain rules are thought to be good and some are thought to be bad. Many ask the question "why?" because they do not agree with the majority thought of what is right and what is wrong.
−
Choices Vs. Consequences
  −
Consequences of personal choies may impact on other people and any associated reponsiblities may extend into a wider society. They are major factos in life, as they determine one's relationships with him/herself and with others.
